senselogic.sitevision.api.webresource

Interface FileUtil


  • @Requireable(value="FileUtil")
public interface FileUtil
    File utility interface that handles nodes with primary node type sv:file and sv:temporaryFile.

    Note! This interface is used to create files. You would typically use StructureUtil to move a file and TrashcanUtil to delete a file. To check MIME/Content-Type for a file you would typically use MimeTypeUtil.

    An instance of the Sitevision class implementing this interface can be obtained via Utils.getFileUtil(). See Utils for how to obtain an instance of the Utils interface.

    Since:
    Sitevision 2.6.2
    Author:
    Mikael Wikblom

    • Method Detail

      • createFiles

        void createFiles(Node aParent,
                 Map<String,String> aFileMappings)
          throws ConstraintViolationException,
                 RepositoryException

        Adds several files to a sv:localFileRepository, sv:fileRepository, sv:personalFileRepository or a sv:folder residing as sub node to a file repository.

        Files are specified by a map where the keys denotes the file names (will correspond to the property fileName of the sv:file nodes) and the values denotes the URIs pointing to the file resources. The file resources (i.e. the URIs) must be accessible from the Sitevision server. Sitevision opens a stream with the URI value when creating/uploading the binary content of the file. If a firewall or such blocks outgoing communication from the server - file creation will fail.

        Permission note! Current user must be authorized to alter the parent node (e.g. PermissionUtil.Permission.WRITE).

        A warning will be written to the system log if Sitevision for any reason is unable to create one of the files.

        Parameters:
        aParent - the parent node for the files
        aFileMappings - a map of file name to URI pairs
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if aParent or aFileMappings is null
        ConstraintViolationException - if the user is not authorized to alter the parent node, if an invalid parent node is specified or if file exceeds file size limit
        RepositoryException - if something else goes wrong

      • createFile

        Node createFile(Node aParent,
                String aFileName,
                String aUri)
         throws ConstraintViolationException,
                RepositoryException
        Creates a file using a uri string.

        Note that the aParent of the file must be a sv:localFileRepository, sv:fileRepository, sv:personalFileRepository or a sv:folder residing as sub node to a file repository.

        Permission note! Current user must be authorized to alter the parent node (e.g. PermissionUtil.Permission.WRITE).

        URI note! The file resource must be accessible from the Sitevision server! Sitevision opens a stream to an URL with the aUri value when creating/uploading the binary content of the file. If a firewall or such blocks outgoing communication from the server - file creation will fail.

        Parameters:
        aParent - the parent node of the file
        aFileName - the filename
        aUri - the URI pointing to the file resource retrievable from the Sitevision server
        Returns:
        a sv:file node corresponding to the newly created file. Will never return null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if aParent, aFileName or aUri is null
        ConstraintViolationException - if the user is not authorized to alter the parent node, if an invalid parent node is specified or if file exceeds file size limit
        RepositoryException - if something else goes wrong

      • createFileFromBase64

        Node createFileFromBase64(Node aParent,
                          String aFileName,
                          String aBase64EncodedString)
                   throws ConstraintViolationException,
                          RepositoryException
        Creates a file using a base64 string.

        The base64 decoder uses "The Base64 Alphabet" as specified in Table 1 of RFC 4648 and RFC 2045 for decoding operation. The decoder rejects data that contains characters outside the base64 alphabet.

        Note that the aParent of the file must be a sv:localFileRepository, sv:fileRepository, sv:personalFileRepository or a sv:folder residing as sub node to a file repository.

        Permission note! Current user must be authorized to alter the parent node (e.g. PermissionUtil.Permission.WRITE).

        Parameters:
        aParent - the parent node of the file
        aFileName - the filename
        aBase64EncodedString - a base64 encoded string
        Returns:
        a sv:file node corresponding to the newly created file. Will never return null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if aParent, aFileName or aBase64EncodedString is null
        ConstraintViolationException - if the user is not authorized to alter the parent node, if an invalid parent node is specified, if aBase64EncodedString is not base64 encoded or if file exceeds file size limit
        RepositoryException - if something else goes wrong
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.5.4

      • createFileFromTemporary

        Node createFileFromTemporary(Node aParent,
                             Node aTemporaryFile)
                      throws ConstraintViolationException,
                             RepositoryException
        Creates a file using a sv:temporaryFile.

        Note that the aParent of the file must be a sv:localFileRepository, sv:fileRepository, sv:personalFileRepository or a sv:folder residing as sub node to a file repository.

        Permission note! Current user must be authorized to alter the parent node (e.g. PermissionUtil.Permission.WRITE).

        Parameters:
        aParent - the parent node of the file
        aTemporaryFile - a sv:temporaryFile (typically created via TemporaryFileNodeBuilder)
        Returns:
        a sv:file node corresponding to the newly created file. Will never return null
        Throws:
        ConstraintViolationException - if the user is not authorized to alter the parent node, if an invalid parent node is specified, if an invalid temporary node is specified or if file exceeds file size limit
        RepositoryException - if something else goes wrong
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.5.4

      • updateBinaryContent

        void updateBinaryContent(Node aFile,
                         String aUri)
                  throws ConstraintViolationException,
                         RepositoryException
        Updates the binary content of an existing file using a uri string.

        Properties related to the binary content will also be updated (e.g. length). A new version will be created if the binary content of a group file is updated.

        URI note! The URI must be accessible from the Sitevision server and the ending part of the URI must match the file extension of the existing file that should be updated! Sitevision opens a stream to an URL with the anUri value when uploading the binary content of the file. If a firewall or such blocks outgoing communication from the server - file update will fail.

        Permission note! Current user must be authorized to alter the file node that should be updated (e.g. PermissionUtil.Permission.WRITE).

        Parameters:
        aFile - the file
        aUri - the URI pointing to the file resource to fetch new binary content from
        Throws:
        ConstraintViolationException - if the user is not authorized to alter the file node, if an invalid node is specified, if the end part of aUri doesn't match the file extension of aFile or if file exceeds file size limit
        RepositoryException - if something else goes wrong
        Since:
        Sitevision 3.6.3

      • updateBinaryContentFromBase64

        void updateBinaryContentFromBase64(Node aFile,
                                   String aBase64EncodedString)
                            throws ConstraintViolationException,
                                   RepositoryException
        Updates the binary content of an existing file using a base64 string.

        The base64 decoder uses "The Base64 Alphabet" as specified in Table 1 of RFC 4648 and RFC 2045 for decoding operation. The decoder rejects data that contains characters outside the base64 alphabet.

        Properties related to the binary content will also be updated (e.g. length). A new version will be created if the binary content of a group file is updated.

        Permission note! Current user must be authorized to alter the file node that should be updated (e.g. PermissionUtil.Permission.WRITE).

        Parameters:
        aFile - the file
        aBase64EncodedString - a base64 encoded string
        Throws:
        ConstraintViolationException - if the user is not authorized to alter the file node, if an invalid node is specified, if aBase64EncodedString is not base64 encoded, if file exceeds file size limit or if file exceeds file size limit
        RepositoryException - if something else goes wrong
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.5.4

      • updateBinaryContentFromTemporary

        void updateBinaryContentFromTemporary(Node aFile,
                                      Node aTemporaryFile)
                               throws ConstraintViolationException,
                                      RepositoryException
        Updates the binary content of an existing file using a sv:temporaryFile.

        Properties related to the binary content will also be updated (e.g. length). A new version will be created if the binary content of a group file is updated.

        Permission note! Current user must be authorized to alter the file node that should be updated (e.g. PermissionUtil.Permission.WRITE).

        Parameters:
        aFile - the file
        aTemporaryFile - the sv:temporaryFile (typically created via TemporaryFileNodeBuilder)
        Throws:
        ConstraintViolationException - if the user is not authorized to alter the file node, if an invalid node is specified, if the end part of the file represented by aTemporaryFile doesn't match the file extension of aFile or if file exceeds file size limit
        RepositoryException - if something else goes wrong
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.5.4

      • getContentAsString

        String getContentAsString(Node aFile)
        Gets the contents of a file as a String using the UTF-8 character encoding.

        Note! This is mere a convenience method for getContentAsString(Node, String) using UTF-8 as character encoding.

        Parameters:
        aFile - the file Node (sv:file or sv:temporaryFile)
        Returns:
        the UTF-8 file content, or null if aFile isn't a character-based file
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.1.1
        See Also:
        getContentAsString(Node, String)

      • getContentAsString

        String getContentAsString(Node aFile,
                          String aCharacterEncoding)
        Gets the contents of a file as a String using a given character encoding.

        Note! This method operates on character-based file nodes only! That is:

        • Files that are of text type (as of MimeTypeUtil.isTextType(String)).
        • Files that are of xml type (as of MimeTypeUtil.isXmlType(String)).
        • Common "cross-over/mixed-types" files, such as json (application type) and svg (image type).
        Parameters:
        aFile - the file Node (sv:file or sv:temporaryFile)
        aCharacterEncoding - the character encoding (Note! UTF-8 will be used instead for null, empty and illegal/unsupported encoding)
        Returns:
        the file content using the specified character encoding, or null if aFile isn't a character-based file
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.1.1

      • renameFile

        void renameFile(Node aFile,
                String aNewName)
         throws ConstraintViolationException,
                RepositoryException
        Alters the name of a file.

        If no file is specified a NullPointerException is thrown. If the node is not a sv:file an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If no name is provided a NullPointerException is thrown.

        Permission note! Current user (the invoker of this method) must have WRITE permission on the file node that should be updated (see PermissionUtil.Permission.WRITE). Updating a file for a sv:userIdentity requires PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_USER_IDENTITIES on current page.

        Parameters:
        aFile - the sv:file that should be renamed. May not be null
        aNewName - the new name of the file. May not be null
        Throws:
        ConstraintViolationException - if the current user is not authorized to alter the name of the file or if the file extension doesn't match
        RepositoryException - if something else goes wrong
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.5.2

      • setVersioned

        void setVersioned(Node aFile,
                  boolean aVersioned)
           throws ConstraintViolationException,
                  RepositoryException
        Modifies versioning for a file.

        Permission note! Current user (the invoker of this method) must have WRITE permission on the file node that should be updated (see PermissionUtil.Permission.WRITE).

        Parameters:
        aFile - the sv:file. May not be null
        aVersioned - the new state of versioning for this file
        Throws:
        ConstraintViolationException - if the current user is not authorized to mutate aFile or if aFile is not a sv:file
        RepositoryException - if something else goes wrong
        Since:
        Sitevision 9.1

      • setDownloadProtected

        void setDownloadProtected(Node aFile,
                          boolean aDownloadProtected)
                   throws RepositoryException
        Modifies download protection for a file.

        Permission note! Current user (the invoker of this method) must have WRITE permission and MANAGE_DOWNLOAD_PROTECTION permission on the file node that should be updated (see PermissionUtil.Permission.WRITE and PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_DOWNLOAD_PROTECTION).

        Tip! Use PropertyUtil or Properties to check current state, i.e. the "downloadProtected" boolean property.

        Parameters:
        aFile - the sv:file. May not be null
        aDownloadProtected - the new state of download protection for aFile
        Throws:
        ConstraintViolationException - if the current user is not authorized to mutate aFile or if aFile is not a sv:file
        RepositoryException - if something else goes wrong
        Since:
        Sitevision 2022.08.1

Sitevision - Portal and Content Management Made Easy
Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).
